item.title: mapping
item.description: Mapping is one of ways of storing organized data in [[web3/solidity/Solidity]]. It’s essentially a key-value store for storing and looking up data.

item.title: msg.sender
item.description: In [[web3/solidity/Solidity]] msg.sender is the wallet address of the person who called the function.

item.title: payable modifier
item.description: payable denotes a function that can fund the [[web3/Smart contracts|contract]] and payout money from it to the users interacting with it.

item.title: pragma
item.description: 1 pragma solidity ^0.8.17; States the [[web3/solidity/Solidity]] version that should be used to compile the [[web3/Smart contracts|smart contract]] in [[Ethereum]] network.

item.title: state variable
item.description: In [[web3/solidity/Solidity]] a state variable is the one that is stored permanently in contract storage. State variables are declared outside of the scope of the function.

item.title: variable types
item.description: In [[web3/solidity/Solidity]], there are two locations you can store variables â€” in storage and in memory. storage variables are stored permanently on the [[blockchain]].

item.title: view function modifier
item.description: A view function modifier in [[web3/solidity/Solidity]] denotes a function used for reading data from the [[web3/Smart contracts|smart contract]]. When we read data from the smart contract, no [[web3/transaction]] is made and the [[web3/ethereum/gas-fee]] is not applied, since we’re not making any changes to the [[web3/blockchain]].
